item.title: Street bin emtied bags left by side of Road, 19th December
item.description:
The street bins were reported as overflowing on 16/12/25 the bins were emptied / changed on the 17/12/25 but the bags were left by the side of the road until today 19/12/25 the foxes had torn apart the bags and left litter all over the road. The school has dealt with the problem themselves and disposed of the street rubbish into there own waste bins, As pointed out in previous report this is an ongoing problem and the school and local residents would appreciate it being resolved as it is clearly a health hazard.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Milverton Way, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing drain, 19th December
item.description:
Good Mornong This drain has been overflowing for a while. Now it’s starting to become dangerous as the lid is lifting and water is started to form into large puddles. The drain is located behind the bus stop next to213 Crayford way. Thames water have been contacted but have said it’s not their drain. Could this please be sorted ASAP Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crayford Way, Barnes Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous junction, no pedestrian crossing, 19th December
item.description:
The four way junction at the top of Osidge lane with Avenue Road crossing Chase Side has an extremely high accident rate and has no pedestrian crossing amenities; Can some road calming features be added to this junction along with a means for pedestrians to cross the road at this junction.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Osidge Lane, Brunswick Park, Greater London
